Intro.content: Today we want to create some conflict for our test subject.
By scattering predators throughout the island, we force the test subject to confront the "other"
For without the "other" there is no self.
We want to set up the island with 15 predators.
The test subject will not be aware of anything until we choose.
Firstly, the meek crab, which barely presents a challenge.
Secondly, the porcupine, a tougher opponent for sure.
Lastly, the wild boar, a formidable foe.
Now, place 15 of these and we can begin.
Feel free to mix and match however it may please.

Main1 (After 15 placed).content: Now the test subject must defend themselves.
So we will provide a weapon.
Place either a stone or a stick.
Leave it further from the test subject to give an extra challenge.
Or closer to make things easy.

Complete - Easy.content: A bit too easy for the test subject I see.
A lack of conflict implies a lack of purpose.

Complete - Hard.content: A tough challenge for the test subject I see.
Take care to create disorder, but not abject chaos.

Outro.content: Conflict brings about a further separation of one from the "other"
Friends draw closer together as one. But enemies push each other apart as many.
